question: Why is AWS more economical than traditional data centers for applications with varying compute workloads?
choices: Amazon EC2 costs are billed on a monthly basis
Users retain full administrative access to their Amazon EC2 instances
Amazon EC2 instances can be launched on demand when needed.
Users can permanently run enough instances to handle peak workloads
description: The ability to launch instances on demand when needed allows users to launch and terminate instances inresponse to a varying workload. This is a more economical practice than purchasing enough on-premises servers to handle the peak load.
